Posts.Content: Hi Jackie  Thank you for sharing and advice. I feel a bit better now. Still feeling dizzy from chemo but looking forward to the surgery now.  Best of luck to you!
Posts.Title: Awaiting for the surgery

Posts.Content: Hi R Thank you very much for the prompt response.  To be honest I haven’t got any decisions regarding the surgery yet that’s why I am panicking a little bit. I like to have a plan.  At the moment I am taking paracetamol and codeine and barely helps with the pain, this is why I am concerned what is going to be like when they actually cut me open.  Thanks
Posts.Title: Awaiting for the surgery

Posts.Content: Hi Ella70 Thank you so much for your response.    I feel much calmer about all of this now.  Hopefully, it will be pain free for me too.  Best of luck to you!
Posts.Title: Awaiting for the surgery

Posts.Content: Hi MarbellaGirl  Thank you for sharing your story, it must have been horrible to go through it like that.  I hope you feel a bit better now and recovering quickly.  To be honest I am all calm now and waiting for the surgery patiently. It cannot be worse than chemo or being in the hospital with the temperature which happened twice so far and I must say A&E was the worst experience I have ever had.  All the best to you
Posts.Title: Awaiting for the surgery

Posts.Content: Hello everyone  I am on the 5th cycle of FEC and side effects are just awful. One more to go and then the surgery which I know nothing about.  My lump has shrank half of the size so that's good news but still the unknown is very frustrating. During the surgery they will remove my lymph nodes also so a bit scared of pain. The pain is my main concern.. At the moment not dealing with it too good. Any advice regarding the surgery would be appreciated. Thank you
Posts.Title: Awaiting for the surgery
